paper_abstract: Given a matrix A is an element of Z(mxn) satisfying certain regularity assumptions, a well-known integer programming problem asks to find an integer point in the associated knapsack polytope P(A,b) = {x is an element of R->= 0(n) : Ax = b} or determine that no such point exists. We obtain an LLL-based polynomial time algorithm that solves the problem subject to a constraint on the location of the vector b.
